questions.explanation: For 4.7 to 1 d.p., the upper bound is 4.75 (halfway to the next value)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: √2 is an irrational number.
questions.explanation: √2 cannot be expressed as a fraction of integers, making it irrational.

questions.explanation: x⁰ = 1 for all non-zero values of x (0⁰ is undefined)

questions.questionText: Order these numbers from smallest to largest: π, √10, 3.2, 22/7

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Express the recurring decimal 0.3̄6̄ as a fraction.
questions.explanation: 0.3̄6̄ = 36/99 = 4/11 = 12/33 (all equivalent fractions)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate: (8 × 10⁶) ÷ (4 × 10²)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The product of two irrational numbers is always irrational.
questions.explanation: Counter-example: √2 × √2 = 2, which is rational.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each surd to its simplified form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Using difference of squares: (√5 + √2)(√5 - √2) = (√5)² - (√2)² = 5 - 2 = 3

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Round 0.004567 to 2 significant figures.
questions.explanation: The first 2 significant figures are 4 and 5. The next digit (6) rounds 5 up to 6.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the lower bound of 12.5 cm to 3 significant figures.
questions.explanation: 12.5 to 3 s.f. has a lower bound of 12.45 (any value from 12.45 up rounds to 12.5)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Expand: (x + 4)(x - 3)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Factorise: x² - 5x + 6
questions.explanation: We need two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to -5: -2 and -3. So x² - 5x + 6 = (x - 2)(x - 3)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve by factorising: x² + 2x - 8 = 0

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Make y the subject of: x = 2y + 5

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve simultaneously: 2x + y = 7 and x - y = 2
questions.explanation: Adding equations: 3x = 9, so x = 3. Substituting: y = 7 - 2(3) = 1

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The graph of y = x² is a parabola that opens upwards.
questions.explanation: y = x² has a positive coefficient for x², so it opens upwards with vertex at the origin.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The line y = 2x - 3 has a gradient of 2.
questions.explanation: In y = mx + c form, y = 2x - 3 has m = 2, which is the gradient.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the gradient of the line passing through (1, 3) and (4, 12).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each equation to its factorised form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Cross multiply: 3(x + 3) = 2(2x - 1) → 3x + 9 = 4x - 2 → x = 11

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the nth term of: 2, 5, 10, 17, 26, ...
questions.explanation: The sequence is n² + 1: when n=1: 1+1=2, n=2: 4+1=5, n=3: 9+1=10, etc.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Arrange the steps to solve the simultaneous equations 3x + 2y = 12 and x - y = 1.
questions.explanation: Use substitution method: rearrange one equation, substitute into the other, solve, then find the other variable.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Simplify: (3x²y)³
questions.explanation: (3x²y)³ = 3³ × (x²)³ × y³ = 27x⁶y³

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve the inequality: 5 - 2x < 11
questions.explanation: 5 - 2x < 11 → -2x < 6 → x > -3 (inequality reverses when dividing by negative)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the equation of the line with gradient 3 passing through (2, 5).
questions.explanation: Using y - y₁ = m(x - x₁): y - 5 = 3(x - 2) → y = 3x - 6 + 5 → y = 3x - 1

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each quadratic to its solutions.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Express as a single fraction: 2/(x+1) + 3/(x-1)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The lines y = 2x + 1 and y = 2x - 3 are parallel.
questions.explanation: Both lines have the same gradient (m = 2), so they are parallel.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If f(x) = 2x² - 3x + 1, find f(-2).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If y is directly proportional to x², and y = 12 when x = 2, find y when x = 3.
questions.explanation: y = kx². When x=2, y=12: 12 = k(4), so k = 3. When x=3: y = 3(9) = 27

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If y is inversely proportional to x, and y = 6 when x = 4, find y when x = 8.
questions.explanation: y = k/x. When x=4, y=6: 6 = k/4, so k = 24. When x=8: y = 24/8 = 3

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: £2000 is invested at 5% compound interest per year. Find the value after 2 years.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If A is directly proportional to B, then doubling B will double A.
questions.explanation: If A ∝ B, then A = kB. When B doubles, A = k(2B) = 2kB, so A also doubles.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A car depreciates by 15% each year. If it is worth £12000 now, what will it be worth in 2 years?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each proportionality statement to its equation.
questions.explanation: Each proportionality relationship has its corresponding equation with constant k.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The time T to travel a fixed distance varies inversely with speed S. If T = 4 hours when S = 60 km/h, find T when S = 80 km/h.
questions.explanation: T = k/S. When S=60, T=4: k = 240. When S=80: T = 240/80 = 3 hours

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to calculate compound interest.
dragItems: Multiply by P to get final amount
correctArrangement: Multiply by P to get final amount
questions.explanation: First identify values, then apply the compound interest formula step by step.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: y varies directly as x³. When x = 2, y = 24. Find the constant of proportionality k.
questions.explanation: y = kx³. When x=2, y=24: 24 = k(8), so k = 3

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Compound interest always gives more than simple interest for the same rate and time period (more than 1 year).
questions.explanation: Compound interest earns interest on interest, so it always exceeds simple interest after the first year.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A town's population increases by 8% each year. If the current population is 50000, what will it be in 3 years?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each graph type to its proportionality relationship.
questions.explanation: Each proportionality relationship produces a characteristic graph shape.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the original price if £84 includes 20% VAT.
questions.explanation: Let original = x. x × 1.20 = 84. So x = 84/1.20 = £70

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: p is inversely proportional to the square of q. When q = 2, p = 5. Find p when q = 5.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A recipe for 6 people uses 450g of flour. How much flour is needed for 10 people?
questions.explanation: Flour per person = 450/6 = 75g. For 10 people: 75 × 10 = 750g

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the length of a diagonal of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 6 cm.
questions.explanation: Using Pythagoras: d² = 8² + 6² = 64 + 36 = 100. d = 10 cm

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the area of a sector with radius 6 cm and angle 60°.
questions.explanation: Area of sector = (θ/360) × πr² = (60/360) × π × 36 = (1/6) × 36π = 6π cm²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the arc length of a sector with radius 10 cm and angle 72°.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Similar triangles have equal angles but sides in proportion.
questions.explanation: Similar shapes have the same angles, but their corresponding sides are in the same ratio.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Congruent shapes have the same size and shape.
questions.explanation: Congruent shapes are identical in size and shape - they can be superimposed exactly.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Two similar triangles have areas in the ratio 4:9. What is the ratio of their corresponding sides?
questions.explanation: For similar shapes, if area ratio is k², then length ratio is k. √(4/9) = 2/3, so ratio is 2:3

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each transformation to its description.
questions.explanation: Each transformation affects a shape in a different way.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A shape is enlarged by scale factor 3 from centre O. If the original area is 8 cm², what is the new area?
questions.explanation: Area scale factor = (linear scale factor)² = 3² = 9. New area = 8 × 9 = 72 cm²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order these angle facts from smallest to largest angle sum.
questions.explanation: Interior angle sum = (n-2) × 180° where n is the number of sides.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the interior angle of a regular octagon.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the volume of a cone with radius 3 cm and height 7 cm. Use π = 22/7.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the volume of a sphere with radius 6 cm. Use π = 3.14.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The point (3, -2) is translated by the vector (−4, 5). What are the new coordinates?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each 3D shape to its volume formula.
questions.explanation: Each 3D shape has its specific volume formula.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the distance between points (1, 2) and (7, 10).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the midpoint of the line segment joining (2, 6) and (8, 12).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Two similar solids have volumes in the ratio 8:27. What is the ratio of their surface areas?
questions.explanation: Volume ratio = k³, so k = ∛(8/27) = 2/3. Surface area ratio = k² = 4/9

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Angles in a semicircle are always 90°.
questions.explanation: An angle inscribed in a semicircle (subtended by the diameter) is always a right angle (90°).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the surface area of a sphere with radius 5 cm. Use π = 3.14.
questions.explanation: Surface area = 4πr² = 4 × 3.14 × 25 = 314 cm²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps for finding the length of an unknown side using trigonometry.
questions.explanation: First identify what you know, then choose the correct ratio, set up the equation, and solve.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Two events A and B are mutually exclusive. P(A) = 0.3 and P(B) = 0.4. Find P(A or B).
questions.explanation: For mutually exclusive events: P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) = 0.3 + 0.4 = 0.7

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Two independent events A and B have P(A) = 0.5 and P(B) = 0.3. Find P(A and B).
questions.explanation: For independent events: P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B) = 0.5 × 0.3 = 0.15

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If two events are mutually exclusive, they cannot both occur at the same time.
questions.explanation: Mutually exclusive events cannot happen together, so P(A and B) = 0.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The interquartile range is Q3 - Q1.
questions.explanation: The interquartile range (IQR) is the difference between the upper quartile (Q3) and lower quartile (Q1).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A bag contains 5 red and 3 blue balls. Two balls are drawn without replacement. Find P(both red).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each statistical measure to its calculation.
questions.explanation: Q1, Q2, Q3 represent the quartiles at 25%, 50%, and 75%. IQR = Q3 - Q1.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the estimated mean from this frequency table: Score 1-10 (f=4), 11-20 (f=8), 21-30 (f=6).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps for drawing a cumulative frequency diagram.
dragItems: Plot upper class boundary vs cumulative frequency
Join points with a smooth curve
correctArrangement: Plot upper class boundary vs cumulative frequency
Join points with a smooth curve
questions.explanation: First calculate running totals, plot points, draw curve, then use to find quartiles.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A coin is biased so P(heads) = 0.6. If tossed 3 times, find P(exactly 2 heads).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Data set: 5, 8, 8, 10, 12, 15, 18, 20. Find the interquartile range.
questions.explanation: Q1 = (8+8)/2 = 8, Q3 = (15+18)/2 = 16.5... Actually Q1 = 8, Q3 = 16.5, but typically Q1=(8+8)/2=8 and Q3=(15+18)/2=16.5, IQR = 8.5. Let me recalculate: with 8 values, Q1 is average of 2nd and 3rd = (8+8)/2 = 8, Q3 is average of 6th and 7th = (15+18)/2 = 16.5, IQR = 16.5 - 8 = 8.5 ≈ 9

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each probability scenario to its solution approach.
questions.explanation: Different probability rules apply depending on the relationship between events.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In a tree diagram, one branch shows P(rain) = 0.3 leading to P(late|rain) = 0.4. Find P(rain and late).
questions.explanation: P(rain and late) = P(rain) × P(late|rain) = 0.3 × 0.4 = 0.12

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A box plot shows the median, quartiles, and range of a data set.
questions.explanation: A box plot displays the minimum, Q1, median, Q3, and maximum, showing spread and distribution.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The probability of passing a driving test on the first attempt is 0.6. Find P(passing on exactly the third attempt).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: From a cumulative frequency graph, the median can be read at which position on the frequency axis?
questions.explanation: The median is at the 50th percentile, so read across from n/2 on the cumulative frequency axis.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Simplify: (2/√5)²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate: (3 × 10⁴) + (5 × 10³) in standard form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If f(x) = x² + 3x - 4, find the values of x when f(x) = 0.
questions.explanation: x² + 3x - 4 = 0 factors as (x + 4)(x - 1) = 0, so x = -4 or x = 1

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each line to its properties.
questions.explanation: In y = mx + c, m is the gradient and c is the y-intercept.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In a right triangle, if the opposite side is 5 and the hypotenuse is 13, find sin θ.
questions.explanation: sin θ = opposite/hypotenuse = 5/13

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the angle θ if tan θ = 1.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each trig ratio to its definition.
questions.explanation: SOH CAH TOA: Sin = Opposite/Hypotenuse, Cos = Adjacent/Hypotenuse, Tan = Opposite/Adjacent

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Events A and B are such that P(A) = 0.4 and P(A and B) = 0.1. If A and B are independent, find P(B).
questions.explanation: If independent: P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B). So 0.1 = 0.4 × P(B), P(B) = 0.25

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each diagram type to its use.
questions.explanation: Each type of graph is suited to different types of data and purposes.

questions.questionText: Simplify: √18 + √50 - √8
